data.title: Vaja Pshavela
data.meta_description: vaja pshavela - Free download as Word Doc (.doc / .docx), PDF File (.pdf), Text File (.txt) or read online for free. Vazha-Pshavela was a Georgian poet and writer who used the pen name Vazha-Pshavela, meaning "a son of Pshavians" in Georgian. He was born in 1861 in the village of Chargali in eastern Georgia and studied at the Pedagogical Seminary in Gori and the University of St. Petersburg. As a writer, he is known for his 36 epic poems, around 400 poems, short stories, plays, and works of literary criticism that portrayed everyday life in his native Pshavi province and addressed Georgian history and identity. His best works dealt with the conflict between individuals and their communities as characters questioned outdated social laws in pursuit of greater humanity.
